head.title: Strike at the Modern Derails a Summer Film Series

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Media, Entertainment and Publishing

hedline.hl1: Strike at the Modern Derails a Summer Film Series

block.p: A continuing strike at the Museum of Modern Art has removed another event from its summer calendar. First Run Features, a New York film distribution company, has announced that it is postponing an eight-week retrospective that was to have run from July 27 to Sept. 12. Among the 40 to 50 films scheduled were documentaries, gay and lesbian and foreign films and new releases.

''We feel very strongly about not crossing a union line especially because of the history of our company,'' said Kelly Hargraves, director of publicity for First Run Features. ''The company was started as a company that distributed documentaries and films that deal with social issues, like 'Harlan County USA.' We were very torn because it was a great honor to be at the Museum of Modern Art,'' she said, ''but in the end decided that this was a principle that we believe in very strongly.''

A fund-raising concert by Sheryl Crow for last May was canceled, as well as the eight-week Summergarden series by Juilliard students and graduates, which was to have begun on June 30.
The strike by Local 2110 of the United Automobile Workers, which represents the museum's assistant curators, bookshop workers and other administrative employees, began on April 29.
